intro: Spermacoce brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers and opposite, simple leaves. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and thickets. Spermacoce brasiliensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
